item.title: Words List
item.description: Words List Abate: To become less in amount or intensity. Aberrant: Deviating from the usual course; abnormal. Abhor: To regard with extreme repugnance or aversion. Abjure: To renounce or reject solemnly; to give up under oath. Admonish: To caution or reprimand firmly. Affectation: Artificial behavior intended to impress or deceive. Aggrandize: To make greater, more powerful, or richer. Alacrity: Cheerful readiness or promptness in action. Ambivalent: Having mixed feelings or contradictory ideas about something or someone.
